P

paint(Graphics) - Method in class mickel.anim.Stage
Cycles through another frame of animation by instructing all of its Sprite objects to perform their act() and draw() methods and then updating the screen display accordingly.

NOTE: This method is invoked automatically by the operating system.

Pixel(ColorSpace, float[], float) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel
Creates a Pixel with a color in the specified ColorSpace with the color components specified in the float array and the specified alpha.
Pixel(float, float, float) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel
Creates a Pixel with an opaque sRGB color with the specified red, green, and blue values in the range (0.0 - 1.0).
Pixel(float, float, float, float) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel

Pixel(int) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel
Creates a Pixel with an opaque sRGB color with the specified combined RGB value consisting of the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
Pixel(int, boolean) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel
Creates a Pixel with an sRGB color with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
Pixel(int, int, int) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel
Constructor
Pixel(int, int, int, int) - Constructor for class mickel.image.Pixel

RuntimeErrorDialog - Class in mickel.util
Displays an informative, graphical dialog indicating the occurrence of , a runtime error allowing the user to either "Debug", "Resume", or "Exit" the program.

If enabled (default), the "Debug" option will allow the end-user to launch a DataInspector that will allow them to view the real-time values of all data fields for the specified root object.

In order to use this class, simply invoke it's constructor during the catch block of a try-catch statement, passing in a reference to the Exception (or Error) and a reference to the root object whose data you might like to examine.

try
{
  // ...code that might throw an Exception not shown...
}
catch (Exception e)
{
  new RuntimeError(e, this);
}
RuntimeErrorDialog(Throwable, Object) - Constructor for class mickel.util.RuntimeErrorDialog
Displays a dialog containing relevant information about a runtime error and allows the user to either "Debug", "Resume", or "Exit" the program.
